page.title: 09All Saints Church Hilton
page.content: Services are still held every sunday in the 15th Century church at Hilton with a small but active congregation. A fine Purbeck marble font with a square bowl is to be seen in the church. also, part of the rood screen from Milton Abby with the twelve paintings of Saints that were restored at the Courtauld Institute is now in the church. At the dissolution in 1530 the window in the north wall came from the cloisters at Milton Abby. There are six bells, four of them made before 1690, two of them inscribed, which are now in need of repair. On December 1st 1985 they were rung for the last time in their present state at a special Matins appeal service to launch the Bell fund to enable the bells to be restored.
